instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the batteryâ€™s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A
threads.message: this board  damages the original batteries after a while use, has already damaged 3 batteries original app store

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A
threads.message:
You need to post more information here.
What voltages do you get with "damaged" battery?
How much time did work such battery, before dies?
Exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage without battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A
threads.message:
What voltages do you get with "damaged" battery? which voltages only  battery bad without charger? 
How much time did work such battery?, before dies?around 1 month and bad battery comes back
Exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage without battery? 8.6v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A
threads.message:
"What voltages do you get with "damaged" battery? which voltages only  battery bad without charger?"
Both cases; battery w/ and w/o charger connected.
Also post voltage and diode mode on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A
threads.message:
with battery and charger connected <SIGNAL>PVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>=8.18V <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=8.35
only batery=<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>=7.35V  <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>=7.33V
only charger=<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>=8.6vV
SCL=0.544 SDA=0.53 on j6950 pin 4,5 mode diode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>=7.35V  <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>=7.33V"
I'm not sure what you meant here.

"SCL=0.544 SDA=0.53"
Too big difference, considering you've meant 0.530 there.
This points to <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, or SMC issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A
threads.message:
Remove <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and check again SCL/SDA.
If still big difference, SMC is the last.

Let the board cools down, before measuring in diode mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A
threads.message: excuse me I came back and measured like this SCL/SDA SCL=0.550 SDA=0.546 is it still a lot of difference?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A
threads.message:
Not too big, but usually should get almost the same value.

Be sure battery connector is good; sometime I found broken pins.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A
threads.message: a question where do you buy batteries? in ebay?some recommendation how to search?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A
threads.message:
I never bought Apple batteries on eBay.
I repair more for other services, they chnage the batteries when needed.
I have old original "known good" batteries in stock, only for tests; not for all models, unfortunatelly.
